we're the global leader in providing energy solutions that help businesses grow and communities thrive.

we work as a team and we’re proud of the difference we make to customers, to local communities, and towards a sustainable future for the world.

we’re looking for a skilled and passionate control systems design engineer with expertise in renewable energy and hybrid system design to join our high-calibre engineering team in manila. the successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing advanced control systems that optimize the performance and integration of renewable and hybrid energy solutions. this role requires a strong foundation in control theory, power electronics, and system integration, with a focus on sustainable energy technologies.

why aggreko? here are some of the perks and rewards.

innovative projects: be at the forefront of sustainable energy solutions, making a real impact.
professional growth: benefit from ongoing training and career development opportunities.
diverse and inclusive team: join a global, collaborative, and supportive work environment.
competitive benefits – enjoy market-leading pay, bonuses, and career progression.

  

what you’ll do:  

design and develop control algorithms and systems for renewable energy sources (solar, wind, etc.) and hybrid power systems.
collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate control systems with power electronics, energy storage, and grid interfaces.
conduct system modeling, simulation, and analysis to validate control strategies and optimize system performance.
develop and maintain control system documentation, including specifications, design reports, and test plans.
support hardware-in-the-loop (hil) testing and commissioning of control systems in laboratory and field environments.
troubleshoot and resolve control system issues during development, testing, and deployment phases.
stay current with industry trends, standards, and emerging technologies in renewable energy and control systems.
provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and technicians.
ensure compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory requirements.

  

you’ll have the following skills and experience: 

bachelor’s or master’s degree in electrical engineering, control systems engineering, or a related field.
proven experience in control systems design, preferably within renewable energy and hybrid power systems.
strong knowledge of control theory, digital signal processing, ip networking, remote access, vlans and embedded systems.
experience with simulation tools such as matlab/simulink, pscad, or similar.
experience with codesys, rslogix, schneider plcs, and plantscada / citect.
familiarity with power electronics, energy storage systems, and grid interconnection standards.
proficiency in programming languages such as c/c++, python, or similar for control algorithm development.
excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and in a team environment.
strong communication skills for technical documentation and cross-team collaboration.

preferred:

hands-on experience with control systems engineering and renewable energy technologies (solar pv, wind turbines, battery energy storage).
experience designing, programming and operating hybrid systems combining multiple energy sources.
knowledge of australian industry standards and certifications related to renewable energy and control systems.
experience with real-time control platforms and hardware-in-the-loop testing.

  

if you’re ready to take your career to the next level and contribute to a more sustainable future, we’d love to hear from you!

apply today and be part of the change.

join us. bring your energy. grow your career.

ready to become part of the dynamic accenture team? we’re seeking candidates with the right skills and experience for this role. think you match the profile? reach out to us, we'd love to hear from you!


what you'll do:
as an rpa developer, you will engage in the design, construction, and configuration of applications tailored to fulfill specific business processes and application requirements. your typical day will involve collaborating with various teams to ensure that the applications meet the necessary standards and effectively address the needs of the organization. you will also be responsible for troubleshooting and providing solutions to any issues that arise during the development process, ensuring a smooth workflow and optimal performance of the applications.

expected to be an sme.

the candidate should have minimum 3 years of experience in automation anywhere

what’s in it for you?

planit are world leaders in application testing and quality engineering. we provide solutions that support organisations to deliver high quality systems, applications, and it architecture.

planit is now a proud nri company and part of a global movement to deliver a sustainable and secure future through better information technology exchanges. our team offer expert consultancy, bespoke services, tailored training and unique solutions to complex projects. specialising in digital quality, planit have a geographic footprint across many continents, with 1700+ permanent employees and have been recognised in gartner's magic quadrant for application testing services.

our values and ethos are focused on an intrinsic connection to our people, the awareness of our environment and our pursuit to be better than yesterday. we continue to lead the industry with unrivalled ideas, ability, and a quest to discern paradigms.

about the role:

as a planit test engineer you will demonstrate passion and enthusiasm of the testing activities at a project level, and be involved in the planning, monitoring and control of the testing activities to a high standard of quality across single/multiple clients. you should be able to understand databases, write sql and understand and perform api testing

you will be joining our exceptionally talented team, we can give you variety, flexibility, opportunities while supporting our clients on their quality assurance journey. 

responsibilities:

you will be involved with automation test planning, analysis, design, estimation, execution, defect management and reporting. the role will see you performing the usual testing activities day to day to test the behaviour, functionality and integrity of software programmes, including:

review requirements for testability
consult with clients for user and systems requirements when documentation is insufficient
determine test conditions/ test objectives
create comprehensive test cases relevant to test conditions
execute test cases and report results
manage the defect process as required
raise and close defects when necessary
report results periodically to managers across the business

essential skills and experience:

at least 3 years’ hands on experience in testing all areas of sdlc/stlc
wdio or selenium frameworks
strong javascript/typsecript coding
cucumbr
axios (or similar) for api testing
skills across numerous test levels, including uat, system and sit
able to work within a team responsible for the analysis and planning of large-scale projects
ability to provide estimates for test resources (time, people, environments etc.) and create reports
excellent stakeholder engagement abilities

culture & benefits

we believe in fostering a culture where our people are rewarded for the work they do and looked after from their first day at planit!

get recognised for your contribution - actually seeing progression and awards based on merit
benefit from a structured career path with defined milestones, capabilities, and kpis needed to reach your next level.
make your mark on some of the most interesting projects across our top-tier client base spread across au & nz
join a diverse team of like-minded professionals, develop long lasting bonds, and enjoy fun team events.
receive paid health insurance (hmo) through our provider philcare
life insurance coverage first life financial
personal accident coverage
20 days paid leave per year
group personal accident insurance - chubb
payroll easy accounts - security bank
get full access to planit's academy and apollo training programmes, linkedin learning, and other third-party training.
global opportunities for transfers and secondments across the planit group.

job description

renesas electronics is looking for a skilled professional to fill the role of equipment engineer supporting ion implant in its manufacturing facility in palm bay, florida. the successful candidate will be a self-starter with excellent project and communication skills. this position offers professional development opportunities working for a leader in the design and manufacture of high-performance analog semiconductors. if you are qualified and interested we invite you to apply.

essential job responsibilities:

· owner/subject matter expert for assigned equipment.

· monitor and improve equipment performance. i.e. availability, throughput, line yield, and cost of ownership.

· generate and update tool maintenance specifications as needed.

· assist and train (hands-on) technicians as needed.  

· troubleshoot and diagnose complex equipment problems; define and implement solutions.

· design, test, and implement equipment improvements and modifications.

· identify and evaluate second source parts suppliers; address parts obsolescence issues.

· assist with equipment purchases, installations, relocations, and qualification.

qualifications

education requirements:

· bs or equivalent in appropriate engineering discipline.   

qualified work experience, training, or military training and service in the proper engineering area may be substituted for the formal education requirement.

experience requirements:

· 5 or more years of semiconductor experience in equipment engineering, ion implant expertise required.

additional experience (required):

experience supporting the following implanters, amat 9500xr, varian e220/e500, or equivalent.
excellent mechanical and electronic skills.
strong problem-solving capabilities.

additional experience (preferred):

· past experience supporting the following implanters, amat 9500xr, varian e220/e500, or equivalent.

· previous experience as an oem field service engineer a plus.

additional experience (desired):

experience supporting thin films equipment, amat 5500 endura, novellus c1, varian 3xxx, wj999r, amat p5000/p5200, or equivalent.

additional information

this position is on a compressed work week, 12-hour shifts, 3 days on 7am - 7pm one week, and the next week 4 days on and 3 days off.

competitive benefits package include:

medical, dental, vision insurance from day one
3 weeks of vacation per year
13 paid holidays per year
generous 401k plan that includes employer matching up to 6%
tuition reimbursement
life insurance and disability coverage

renesas is an embedded semiconductor solution provider driven by its purpose ‘to make our lives easier.’ as the industry’s leading expert in embedded processing with unmatched quality and system-level know-how, we have evolved to provide scalable and comprehensive semiconductor solutions for automotive, industrial, infrastructure, and iot industries based on the broadest product portfolio, including high performance computing, embedded processing, analog & connectivity, and power.
 
with a diverse team of over 22,000 professionals in more than 30 countries, we continue to expand our boundaries to offer enhanced user experiences through digitalization and usher into a new era of innovation. we design and develop sustainable, power-efficient solutions today that help people and communities thrive tomorrow, ‘to make our lives easier.’     
 
at renesas, you can: 

launch and advance your career in technical and business roles across four product groups and various corporate functions. you will have the opportunities to explore our hardware and software capabilities and try new things.  
make a real impact by developing innovative products and solutions to meet our global customers' evolving needs and help make people’s lives easier, safe and secure. 
maximize your performance and wellbeing in our flexible and inclusive work environment. our people-first culture and global support system, including the remote work option and employee resource groups, will help you excel from the first day.    

are you ready to own your success and make your mark?  

join renesas. shape your future with us.

job title
system & customer support engineer job description
about signify


through bold discovery and cutting-edge innovation, we lead an industry that is vital for the future of our planet: lighting. through our leadership in connected lighting and the internet of things, we're breaking new ground in data analytics, ai, and smart solutions for homes, offices, cities, and beyond.

at signify, you can shape tomorrow by building on our incredible 125+ year legacy while working toward even bolder sustainability goals. our culture of continuous learning, creativity, and commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers you to grow your skills and career.

join us, and together, we’ll transform our industry, making a lasting difference for brighter lives and a better world. you light the way.

more about the role


this is an exciting job opportunity for you to light the way as a system and customer support engineer in pila, poland.

as a system and customer support engineer (field service engineer), you will be at the forefront of our customer interactions, ensuring their satisfaction and the seamless operation of our systems. your primary responsibilities will include:

customer service excellence: directly servicing our valued customers, ensuring their needs are met with professionalism and expertise.
site commissioning: bringing new sites to life by commissioning them with precision and care.
troubleshooting: tackling technical issues head-on, both remotely and on-site, to ensure our systems run smoothly.
specialized focus: working extensively with interact agriculture and philips aquaculture systems, you'll be the go-to expert in these cutting-edge technologies.
creative planning: designing and creating lighting plans and layouts, contributing to the overall success of our projects.

key responsibilities:

deliver direct customer support for animal-centric and aqua lighting systems, ensuring a high level of satisfaction.
oversee site commissioning, guaranteeing the proper installation and optimal functioning of lighting systems.
address and resolve technical issues both remotely and on-site, providing timely and effective solutions.
partner with customers to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions that meet their specific requirements.
create detailed lighting plans and layouts for interact agriculture and philips aquaculture systems.
facilitate training sessions for customers, covering system operation and maintenance.
collaborate closely with the sales team to assist with pre-sales activities and product demonstrations.
keep meticulous records of service activities, including comprehensive reports and documentation.
stay informed about industry trends and emerging technologies related to animal-centric and aqua lighting systems.
adhere to safety regulations and company policies at all times,

more about you

we are seeking potential candidates who possess the following qualifications and attributes:

a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, or a related field.
a passion for field service engineering with a strong customer focus.
robust technical skills and a solid understanding of lighting systems and controls.
excellent communication and customer service abilities.
the capability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
proficiency in cad software for designing lighting plans is a plus.
a willingness to travel to customer sites as needed, with up to 25% travel required.
everything we’ll do for you


you can grow a lasting career here. we’ll encourage you, support you, and challenge you. we’ll help you learn and progress in a way that’s right for you, with coaching and mentoring along the way. we’ll listen to you too, because we see and value every one of our 30,000+ people.

we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a full spectrum of bright ideas. with a global workforce representing 99 nationalities, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where every voice is heard and valued, helping us all achieve more together.

if you have a passion for providing technical support and services in the animal-centric and aqua lighting fields, and you meet the qualifications outlined above, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. join our team and help us make a difference in the agriculture and aquaculture industries through sustainable, innovative lighting solutions.

vertiv is hiring a service technical support engineer to support our rapid business expansion, we are creating a high-impact position focused on embedding service readiness into the new product development and introduction (npdi) process across our power and thermal product portfolios — including ups, sts, batteries, switchgear, busway, crac units, chillers, and liquid cooling systems.

this role is ideal for a hands-on engineer who can proactively identify service gaps, drive cross-functional coordination, and build repeatable, scalable processes that ensure all products are launch-ready from a service perspective. you will play a key role in closing the loop between engineering and service — improving maintainability, documentation, spare parts planning, and long-term field support for mission-critical infrastructure.

responsibilities

engage with r&d teams during early development stages to identify serviceability risks and influence design for maintainability.
review and validate design features from a service perspective (e.g., accessibility, modularity, fault isolation).
ensure delivery of all service-related documentation and materials (e.g., service manuals, exploded views, tool lists, training packages) prior to launch.
collaborate with logistics, spare parts, and technical support teams to ensure full support readiness on day 1.
maintain and enforce a service readiness checklist as a mandatory npdi gate.
lead or support field trials, pilot deployments, and feedback integration for design refinement before mass rollout.
participate in or lead fmea and reliability engineering reviews focused on serviceability and field failure prevention.
define internal service readiness best practices and standard workflows for future npdi programs.

qualifications

bachelor's degree in mechanical, electrical, or mechatronics engineering (or related discipline).
minimum 3 years' experience in product development, field service, or technical support — ideally in power systems (e.g., ups, batteries, switchgear) and/or hvac/thermal systems (e.g., crac, chillers, liquid cooling).
strong understanding of the npdi/npi process from a serviceability and lifecycle support standpoint.
proven ability to work across global teams including engineering, service, logistics, and technical documentation.
experience with bom structuring, service documentation, and tools like solidworks, autocad, windchill, or sap.

preferred skills

familiarity with ups and sts/ats topologies, battery chemistries (li-ion, vrla), and bms architecture.
experience with crac units, chillers, direct-to-chip and liquid cooling technologies.
exposure to service software tools, remote diagnostics, firmware upgrade processes, and hmi/scada interfaces.
understanding of applicable compliance standards (e.g., iec 62040, as/nzs 3000, ul, nfpa 70e) for electrical and thermal equipment.

ready to build the future with ai?

at genpact, we don’t just keep up with technology—we set the pace. ai and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. genpact’s ai gigafactory, our industry-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. from large-scale models to agentic ai, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges.

if you thrive in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment, love building and deploying cutting-edge ai solutions, and want to push the boundaries of what’s possible, this is your moment.

genpact (nyse: g) is an advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers lasting value for leading enterprises globally. through our deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead. powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation, our teams implement data, technology, and ai to create tomorrow, today. get to know us at genpact.com and on linkedin, x, youtube, and facebook.

inviting applications for the role of lead consultant, senior test automation engineer!

in this role, you will be a key member of our test automation and global development team. you will design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans and cases while collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure robust test coverage. your expertise in functional testing and automation frameworks will help us deliver high-quality enterprise platforms.

responsibilities

·       design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases.

·       collaborate with development, product management, and other cross-functional teams to understand requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.

·       perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.

·       develop, execute, and maintain automated test scripts.

·       potentially work on the continuous integration framework for the automation suite.

·       build automation frameworks and scripts for end-to-end testing, including api, ui, and other types of testing.

·       identify, document, and track software defects and work with the development team to resolve issues.


qualifications we seek in you!

minimum qualifications / skills

·       experience in software testing and test automation.

·       strong java skills.

·       proficiency in selenium or playwright.

·       experience with sql and rest apis.

·       strong core testing skills with the ability to influence test approaches for repeatable testing and sustainable automation.

·       experience working on enterprise erp platforms.

·       familiarity with etl testing and ci/cd processes.

 


preferred qualifications/ skills

·       strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.

·       ability to operate independently while following existing framework guidelines.

·       resourcefulness in problem-solving and clear articulation of outputs for non-technical stakeholders.

·       capability to navigate vague specifications and coordinate with stakeholders to clarify expectations.

why join genpact?

·       lead ai-first transformation – build and scale ai solutions that redefine industries

·       make an impact – drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter

·       accelerate your career—gain hands-on experience, world-class training, mentorship, and ai certifications to advance your skills

·       grow with the best – learn from top engineers, data scientists, and ai experts in a dynamic, fast-moving workplace

·       committed to ethical ai – work in an environment where governance, transparency, and security are at the core of everything we build

·       thrive in a values-driven culture – our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness - built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion - allow your ideas to fuel progress

come join the 140,000+ coders, tech shapers, and growth makers at genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: up. 

let’s build tomorrow together.

job summary

we are seeking a skilled and proactive rpa developer to create and deploy process automation solutions using robotic process automation tools. the role involves full-cycle automation development — from project identification and analysis through to implementation and deployment.

as an rpa developer, you will collaborate with process analysts, business unit subject matter experts (smes), and technical teams to design and deliver robust, scalable automation solutions that drive operational efficiency and accuracy.

key responsibilities:

design, develop, test, and deploy rpa solutions using industry-standard tools.
analyze business processes for automation suitability and recommend enhancements.
work closely with process analysts and smes to understand process workflows and document automation requirements.
collaborate with technical teams to ensure successful integration of automated processes with existing systems.
monitor and maintain deployed bots, ensuring performance, reliability, and compliance with organizational standards.
provide support during uat and resolve issues post-deployment.
document technical solutions and maintain process documentation.

requirements

minimum requirements:

education: bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, or a related field.
technical skills:
proficiency in ms sql, ms access, oracle db, vba, asp.net, and c#.
familiarity with at least one rpa tool such as uipath, automation anywhere, blue prism, pega, or bpa automate.
experience:
prior experience in designing, developing, and deploying automation solutions.
strong understanding of sdlc and agile development methodologies.
analytical skills: ability to analyze complex processes and identify automation opportunities.
communication: strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
problem-solving: proactive and detail-oriented approach to resolving technical and process-related issues.
preferred qualifications (nice to have):

certification in rpa tools (e.g., uipath certified developer, automation anywhere certified rpa professional).
experience with process mining tools or workflow engines.
knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., python, powershell).
exposure to cloud platforms and api integrations.

job summary

if you are a professional looking for an opportunity to work with the global emerson systems and software organization, this is a stimulating opportunity for you! as a test automation engineer, you will be an integral part of a team dedicated to the development and implementation of various products and applications. your role will involve designing, developing, and maintaining test frameworks, components, and tools necessary for software testing.

  in this role, your responsibilities will be to:

analyzing and understanding existing software.
collaborating with developers to establish automation requirements and ensure code readiness for automation.
crafting frameworks that empower developers to test at all stages of the development process, while contributing to the design of the product codebase by recommending structure, design, and coding practices that facilitate better unit testing.
developing comprehensive test plans and automated tests. writing, executing, and maintaining automated test scripts to validate software functionality and services. ensure tests are effective in identifying issues and meeting project requirements
designing and developing test code to identify issues that redefine end-user experience and workflow.
ensuring that the vital test data is available for test execution by creating mock data or configuring test environments.
analyzing test coverage to ensure that critical paths are adequately tested. identify areas of the codebase that lack sufficient test coverage and develop new automated tests as needed.
participating in code reviews to ensure quality and consistency.
analyzing and reporting test results, including tracking defects and issues uncovered during automated testing.
integrating automation frameworks with ci/cd pipelines. set up and maintain test environments necessary for running automated tests, ensuring consistency and stability.
designing and implementing medium and large-scale integration tests and making valuable contributions to the development of central test infrastructure while assisting software developers with unit-testing challenges.
tapping into your expertise in quality, frameworks, and automation to drive innovation within the organization. 
continuously seeing opportunities to improve automation processes, frameworks, and tools.
staying updated on the latest automation trends and incorporating new technologies into the testing process.

  who you are:

you work cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives. you have a strong bottom-line orientation. you introduce new ways of looking at problems. you provide timely and helpful information to others across the organization. you follow through on commitments and make sure others do the same

  for this role you will need:

bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, or any
minimum of 4 years of experience in windows or web development using languages like c#, .net, python, javascript, etc.
hands-on experience with test-driven development (tdd) or utilizing any test automation framework.
a strong passion for ensuring software quality and a keen curiosity about identifying bugs and automating processes wherever possible.
familiarity or experience with devops practices.
proficiency in working with databases such as ms sql, mysql, oracle, mongodb, etc.
in-depth knowledge of object-oriented design, patterns, and development principles.
creative thinking with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
excellent written and verbal communication skills. 

  preferred qualification that sets you apart:

experience in popular test automation tools (specifically ranorex and selenium) is a plus
experience in mobile test automation, and creating simulator tools for devices is an advantage
experience in agile software development
experience in ai tools (github copilot)

  our culture & commitment to you

at emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. we foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives—because we know that great ideas come from great teams. our commitment to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. we believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results. 

we recognize the importance of employee wellbeing. we prioritize providing competitive benefits plans, a variety of medical insurance plans, employee assistance program, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. our culture offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.

job description:

interface manager

the position is based in manila for nsrc stage 1.

accountabilities

identify, define, control and manage system interfaces
lead technical interface meetings and reporting about interface management
lead interface discussions with technical teams and customer
acquire deep understanding of subsystems provided by external suppliers and ensure compatibility at system level
support system integration manager in technical decisions
active participation in optimal overall project technical solution
support customer design review and internal design reviews
support lab, factory, and field testing
ensure compliance with company processes
understands and integrates applicable cmmi, cenelec, arema, ieee, ipc, etc standards.
coordination of interfaces among contactors, between hsts contract systems and external contractors (external interfaces) and among hsts contract subsystems (internal interfaces), resolution in design, implementation and testing during commissioning phases, in order to secure that the expected functionalities are achieved.

the main methods and tools in managing interfaces are:

•            external interface log and matrix

•            internal interface log and matrix

•            interface specification

•            coordinated interface report

other main activities related to interface management are the following:

monitor and assess progress of all project interface works and report progress / issues to the employer.
provide updates of external interface matrices
internal interfaces management (review, update data base, closing)
external interfaces management (review, update data base, closing)
transfer requirements to subsystems.
subsystems provide evidences of compliance
resolution of each pending issue regarding the interface,
review of evidences
update interface register

required skills/knowledge

minimum  2 years’ experience in system engineering and interface management
ability to acquire deep understanding of new technologies with minimal guidance
ability to communicate complex ideas to peers, management, and customers in a simplified manner
strong technical troubleshooting and problem solving abilities
prior experience applying fundamental systems engineering concepts:
v-lifecycle,
system architecture
requirements management,
configuration management,
interface management,
understanding and/or prior experience with engineering lifecycles, delivery, and hw/sw integration lifecycle
competency in interactions between mechanical, electrical, and software components in complex electromechanical systems
experience with microsoft office suite, requirements management systems, product lifecycle management systems, defect tracking tools, and software configuration tools
competency in use doors tool
success with multi-tasking across multiple projects at given time
builds effective relationships and has exceptional communication and leadership skills
detail oriented with organizational skills
prefer rail or rail transit domain experience, but not required
ability to lead, engage, and manage tasking of cross-functional teams of varying skills/experience
prior experience collaborating with a diverse, cross-functional team across multiple geographic locations.

education

bachelor’s degree

languages

english-proficient

design and develop online, classroom, and blended learning materials using instructional design software such as articulate storyline and articulate rise

by applying, you give consent to collect, store, and/or process personal and/or sensitive information for the purpose of recruitment and employment may it be internal to cobden & carter international and/or to its clients.

what we do

coda delivers commerce solutions that accelerate global growth for our partners. with over a decade of experience, we’re trusted by 300+ publishers—including activision, bigo, electronic arts, moonton, and riot games—to grow their revenue and audiences worldwide.

our suite of solutions includes custom commerce, a fully customizable web store; codapay, enabling seamless direct payments through api integration on publishers’ websites; codashop, the go-to marketplace for millions of gamers to purchase in-game content; and distribution, extending codashop content through our network of trusted commerce partners.

headquartered in singapore with a team of 400+ codans, coda has been recognized as an industry leader, named an apac high growth company (2023) by financial times, one of granite asia’s nextgentech 30 (2024), a payments leader on fortune’s fintech innovation asia list (2024), and listed among the straits times fastest growing fintechs (2024).

for more on how coda helps publishers grow faster and smarter, visit coda.co.

engineering - technology at coda 

at coda, our goal is to make our mark in the high-volume payments and e-commerce industry – and we are levelling up fast. to stay in stride with the dynamic environment, we focus on building robust, distributed systems that can effortlessly handle traffic spikes. moreover, our ambitious roadmap necessitates innovative tools to streamline the development lifecycle and sustain our swift momentum.

we place great value on balancing teamwork with individual autonomy, allowing our teams to make the most of modern cloud infrastructure. our tech stack is solidly based on aws cloud, with a keen interest in infrastructure-as-code and the creation of new microservices via the quarkus framework. our toolbox includes json and grpc, multiple data storage integrations, queues, opentelemetry, and more.

but what truly defines us? it's our incredible team. we hire top talent and give them the freedom to push coda's technology and products to exciting new levels. we believe that genius can strike anywhere, so we promote ownership and cultivate a servant leadership culture that lets engineers take the reins on features.

about the role

we are looking for a proactive, driven engineer who is hungry to contribute using their deep and fundamental knowledge in software development and automation. you will be responsible for the architecture, development, and evolution of key products and features at coda. 

about the experimentation team

the experimentation team is the brand new initiative across coda destined to build a world-class experimentation platform. we combine full-stack and data skills to make feature switching and a/b testing easy and enjoyable. we aim to collect and deliver all the customer behaviour and business information to our product and business users so they can make informed and impactful decisions.

working at coda

with codans spread across over 20 countries worldwide, our fast-paced, challenging, and highly collaborative environment breaks down time zones and cultural barriers, empowering you to chase innovative ideas, contribute to coda’s growth, and make a lasting impact.

if you have a passion for pushing boundaries and thrive on continuous improvement through experimentation, we would love to hear from you!

our perks*

wellness boost: stay healthy with resources for physical and mental well-being with our flexible benefits and employee well-being program - because you matter!

customized benefits: tailor your benefits with our flexible plan.

growth opportunities: unlock your potential through clear progression paths.

skill development: access training resources to fuel your personal and professional growth.

volunteer time off: enjoy paid time off to make a difference in the world through volunteering.

family support: take advantage of paid family care leave to bond with your family, while our selected flexible benefits also cater to your family's needs.

*benefits are reviewed and updated on a yearly basis

we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, embracing the unique qualities of every individual, regardless of gender, race, age, religion, disability, or other local protected classes. our goal is to foster an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome and valued.

due to the large number of exceptional applications we receive, we can only reach out to shortlisted candidates. if you don't hear from us, rest assured there may be another opportunity at coda that aligns better with your unique abilities. remember to check our careers page for more exciting job openings!

responsible for setting-up assembly and test stations - work closely with product and process engineers to build and set-up user friendly workstations consisting of assembly machines, test equipment, jigs and fixtures, and software interfaces to automate the whole process.
responsible for design, selection, buy-off of machine and equipment with consideration of product and process design and requirements. design, install and test equipment upgrades and modifications to improve uptime, yield, cycle time, and machine throughput.
author machine and equipment operating instruction and manual. provide maintenance documents for all equipment and secure all maintenance activities are being carried out as per planned schedule. perform machine and equipment fmea studies and maintain document for out-of-control action plans.
equipment design and development - new parts vendor qualification. support new equipment installation.
report against various functions including equipment uptime, maintenance effectiveness, and maintenance costs versus plan.
develop assembly and test automation solutions - responsible for design, development, simulate and test of automated assembly and test solutions for the whole production operations. this also cover design for assembly and test graphic user interfaces ensuring user-friendly programs, automated data gathering and analysis, and automated report generation.
leads training of engineers, technicians, and operators in operation and maintenance of newly introduced equipment and automation processes.
knowledge on optics specifically on fiber optics and micro-optics device physics is a huge advantage
experience on basic optical fiber skills - fusion splicing, cleaving, termination, and testing is highly desired
familiarity on fiber optics device testing equipment such as laser sources, tunable laser source, optical spectrum analyzers, power meter, br meter, otdr, and related equipment.
basic manufacturing statistics knowledge - correlation, process optimization, hypothesis testing, coefficient of variance analysis, six sigma, and some statistical process control methodologies.
extensive laboratory experience with photonics test and measurement (measurement of attenuation, device insertion loss, return loss, beam profile, spectral profile, optical power, pulse energy, etc.). a working knowledge of labview or other object oriented programming language like c/c++ and visual basic is a plus.
familiar with industry equipment communication interfaces - gpib, rs232, usb, etc. able to communicate equipment with each other and create a routine specific to the assembly and test automation process. familiar with microcontroller, plc, and hmi automation.
good industry automation skills - motion control, vision system, automatic optical inspection, data management and analysis.
able to interpret product design and specification then develop automated robust test and assembly processes to achieve these requirements considering productivity, product quality, and product reliability
able to interpret materials safety data sheets to create or form proper safety practices in each process. keen to operations safety details considering health and safety of individuals as top priority in all actions.

Role of Job: Commissioning Manager - Role located in Montgomery, AL
Description:
career opportunities with thermo systems llc

careers at thermo systems llc

current job opportunities are posted here as they become available.

subscribe to our rss feeds to receive instant updates as new positions become available.

commissioning manager - role located in montgomery, al


thermo systems is a global, full-service controls integrator delivering world-class automation in district energy, life sciences, and mission critical markets. “the thermo way” unites us around three goals—employee success, customer success, and financial strength—fostering an agile, high-trust culture where you can do your best work.

position summary:

the commissioning manager (cxm) oversees all commissioning activities—planning, execution, documentation, and turnover—for a large-scale data-center project in montgomery,?al. you will lead a multi-disciplinary team of commissioning engineers, technicians, and subcontractors to validate building management system (bms), scada, hvac, epms, and water treatment controls from point-to-point testing through integrated systems testing (ist) and owner acceptance. success in this role means delivering a fully functional automation platform that meets stringent uptime, performance, and safety requirements while cultivating a positive, results-driven team culture.

key responsibilities:

leadership & people:

recruit, mentor, and evaluate a team of 6–10 commissioning engineers/technicians.
set clear goals, provide continual feedback, and manage workload to avoid resource bottlenecks.
foster a safety-first, collaborative environment across internal teams, subcontractors, and client stakeholders.
develop and own the commissioning plan, schedule, and checklist matrix aligned with ashrae guideline & meta playbook.

technical & operational:

coordinate fat, sat, functional testing, and ist for bms, plc/scada, epms, and ancillary systems.
drive issue resolution via tracking logs (cx alloy, bim?360, or similar), ensuring closure within sla targets.
author and approve turnover packages—including test scripts, redlines, and o&m documentation—for owner acceptance

commercial & risk:

forecast labor-hour burn, report earned value and manage change orders tied to commissioning scope growth.
identify risks (schedule, technical, commercial) early; develop mitigation plans and communicate impacts to project leadership.
champion thermo’s contractual rights and ensure all additional scope is captured, priced, and approved before execution.

minimum qualifications:

bachelor’s degree in mechanical, electrical, or controls engineering –or equivalent military/industry experience.
7+ years total experience in controls or mep commissioning, with 3+ years in a leadership or management capacity.
demonstrated success delivering commissioning on tier iii/iv data centers, semiconductor fabs, hospitals, or other 24/7 mission-critical facilities.
deep knowledge of bms, plc/scada, epms, and networked automation architectures; ability to read and mark-up p&ids, mep drawings, and sequence of operations.
proficiency with commissioning management software (cx alloy, facility grid, microsoft project) and ms office/teams ecosystem.
excellent written and verbal communication—comfortable presenting to owner leadership, general contractors, and trade partners.
legal authorization to work in the u.s.; ability to pass background check and drug screening.

preferred qualifications:

pmp or similar project-management credential.
prior experience integrating schneider, siemens, or johnson controls bas platforms with aveva or ignition scada.
working knowledge of nfpa 70e, ashrae guideline 1.1, and uptime institute tier standards.

work environment & physical requirements:

full-time, site-based role; typical schedule monday–friday, with occasional nights/weekends during critical cutovers and ist.
ability to climb ladders, access equipment rooms, and lift up to 40?lbs while following thermo safety protocols.
limited domestic travel (<10%) for factory witness tests and cross-site knowledge sharing.

culture:

model thermo systems core values of employee success, customer success and financial strength by:

seeking new and additional business through project change orders, additional services to existing customers, and referrals for new customers/projects. drive financial success.
be a good teammate, support your colleagues, promote a positive atmosphere for those around you. drive employee success.
go the extra mile for your customer, take ownership of their needs, over communicate. drive customer success.
foster an environment of integrity, trust, collaboration, professionalism, serving one another, leading by example, and assuming good intent each and every day.

what you'll get:

competitive salary, annual bonuses, 401(k) with company match, and business travel reimbursement: we appreciate our employees, and we make sure they know it.
benefits: we offer full-time employees multiple healthcare packages, including low-cost options.
casual dress: every day is "casual friday"; we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
training: we offer in-house and factory technical training to keep our staff sharp.
tuition reimbursement: we encourage academic advancement and professional credentialing.
vacation/sick time: we believe work-life balance is essential. ensuring our employees have time to truly relax and recharge is important to us.
culture & extras: we provide free lunches, regular team bonding & fun office events, and plenty of company swag.

thermo systems provides equal employment opportunities (eeo) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.

salary range: $100,000.00 - $135,000.00 annually.

system design and optimization:

industrial engineers design efficient systems for production, including workflows, layouts, and equipment integration. 

process improvement:

they analyze existing processes, identify bottlenecks, and develop solutions to enhance productivity, quality, and efficiency. 

cost analysis:

they evaluate the cost-effectiveness of different processes and make recommendations for cost reduction. 

quality control:

they establish and maintain quality standards for products and processes. 

production planning and scheduling:

they manage production schedules and coordinate resources to ensure timely completion of projects. 

data analysis:

they use data analysis techniques to identify areas for improvement and track the effectiveness of implemented changes. 

collaboration:

they work with cross-functional teams, including operations, supply chain, and quality control, to implement and monitor solutions. 

documentation and reporting:

they document processes, analyze data, and prepare reports on their findings and recommendations. 

ergonomics:

they may also design workstations and work environments to optimize worker comfort and productivity.

the candidate should have minimum 3 years of experience in automation anywhere

strong understanding of application development methodologies.

experience in integrating applications with existing systems.

proficiency in troubleshooting and debugging applications.

familiarity with software development life cycle and agile methodologies.

this position is based at our manila office.

you will be part of accenture’s growing community of technology professionals, continually expanding to provide the best services to our clients.

job description:

we are seeking an industrial engineer to analyze and improve existing workflows and systems within our manufacturing operations. the role involves identifying inefficiencies, implementing improvements, and promoting a culture of continuous improvement.

key responsibilities:

evaluate current workflows, production layouts, equipment usage, material flow, and cycle times to identify areas for improvement.

develop and track performance metrics to measure operational efficiency and highlight bottlenecks.

design and implement process enhancements to increase productivity, reduce waste, and minimize downtime.

conduct time and motion studies to identify the most efficient methods of task execution.

assess production capacity and develop strategies to maximize output.

perform cost analyses to uncover savings opportunities related to materials, labor, and equipment utilization.

collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive continuous improvement initiatives and implement best practices.

qualifications:

bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering or a related field.

proficiency in cad software, microsoft excel, and dynamic nav.

strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

solid understanding of manufacturing processes, production planning, quality control, and lean principles.

prior experience in industrial engineering or a manufacturing environment is a strong advantage.

excellent communication and interpersonal skills; comfortable working with both technical and operational teams.

adaptable and open to working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

description

the automation engineer is responsible for writing test design specifications and automated test cases and designing and developing test automation framework and tools to ensure the functionality of the software. the automation engineer works on high profile and complex assignments/projects. an ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience performing the below duties.

the automation engineer has primary responsibility for designing, implementing, and testing complex tests to ensure features and functionality are fully functional. the position also mentors and guides staff on properly assuring a comprehensive and appropriate approach to testing. the automation engineer is responsible for using this substantial and highly proficient knowledge to make substantial contributions to projects, manage release testing phases, provide project leadership, train new staff, and develop and improve the qa process.

responsibilities


develop, implement, and maintain complex test automation scripts using katalon studio, api testing tools, and other automation frameworks.

optimize test automation frameworks to ensure efficient software functionality testing.

analyze software issues, determine root causes, and provide detailed reports to the development team

actively participate in agile scrum meetings to define test criteria for new feature stories.

plan, design, execute, and maintain well-structured test scripts.

work with product analysts, product managers, and other relevant parties to design and document test cases for new and existing complex product features and functionality within company's software application.

review and edit complex test case scripts to ensure effective test coverage using black-box, exploratory, and end-to-end testing techniques.

conduct thorough and accurate software testing; provide approvals during development sprints, integration, release, regression, and patch software development phases; document results.

work closely with devops and development teams to integrate automated testing into ci/cd pipelines.

ensure compliance with cybersecurity policies related to qa testing and implement best practices for secure software testing.

identify, document, and track software defects in jira, proactively communicating findings with development teams.

conduct various types of testing, including functional, regression, stress, load, and exploratory testing, while assisting in automation efforts.

consult with product development in the design of acceptance test criteria for new product feature stories.

validate written documentation for accuracy and completion.

assist in identifying and implementing new procedures, methods, and tools to enhance qa efficiency.

adhere to and help develop qa policies, procedures, and documentation standards.

communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

maintain an efficient test environment, ensuring products, tools, and data are up to date.

perform additional duties as assigned by management.

qualifications


bachelor's degree or higher in computer sciences, management information science, or business. equivalent work experience may substitute for degree requirements.

3+ years’ experience in software automation testing, quality assurance or related experience including but not limited to writing and executing test cases, test scripts, and plans successfully.

proficient analytical and problem-solving skills involving comprehensive research and fact-finding, effective root cause analysis, sound decision-making, and resolutions.

knowledge of qa testing methodologies, automation best practices, and frameworks.

previous experience developing automated tests using coding languages (such as java, javascript, selenium, katalon) required.

familiarity with soupui/readyapi, postman, jira, zephyr, jenkins, github actions, gitlab ci/cd, katalon are a plus.

solid knowledge and experience with relational databases including solid knowledge and understanding of sql and queries

excellent planning and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple work streams effectively.

effective communication skills (verbal and written), with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

ability to work independently as well as collaborate in a team as well as across functional groups.

experience with the agile – scrum, kanban or lean development processes is required 

communicate technical and non-technical information clearly and effectively/professionally with peers, management, development, support, and other departments within the company.

stay abreast of the latest trends in software development and quality assurance and identify recommended technical solutions to management, leads and/or other appropriate parties.

collaborate with stakeholders to help diagnose issues of basic and moderate complexity; partner with senior/lead staff to resolve complex issues.

assist in designing and carrying out tests to evaluate performance, ensuring results are clearly analyzed and recommendations are suggested under guidance. help define problem statements, highlight risks, and provide supporting analysis for performance improvement, always considering customer needs and business goals. proactively develop technical skills through project involvement, self-learning, and training, aiming for growth in product performance understanding.

collaborate effectively within project teams, communicate findings clearly to stakeholders, and help maintain organized and accessible documentation. contribute ideas for process improvements, support new methods or tools, and participate in activities that enhance product performance and reliability. about you bachelor’s degree in mechanical or mechatronics engineering (or equivalent).

job summary

the automations and projects engineer is responsible for designing and implementing automated solutions to improve business efficiency and streamline operations. this role focuses on using make.com to develop automated workflows, monday.com to optimize team collaboration, and aws services to build and maintain a secure, scalable digital infrastructure. this position oversees automation and digital transformation projects, working closely with stakeholders to define requirements, set timelines, and ensure successful execution. the role also supports company-wide innovation by identifying new technologies and improving existing workflows to enhance productivity. collaboration is key, as the automations and projects engineer partners with it, finance, operations, and other teams to understand their needs and develop tailored automation solutions. ongoing monitoring and support are essential to ensure optimal performance and continuous improvement of implemented solutions. this role is ideal for a problem-solver who is passionate about automation, technology, and driving efficiency through digital solutions.

key responsibilities
1. automation implementation: design, develop, and implement automated workflows and solutions using make.com to streamline and enhance business processes across departments.
2. project management: oversee and manage various automation and digital transformation projects. coordinate with stakeholders to define project requirements, timelines, and deliverables.
3. digital infrastructure: build and maintain the company’s digital infrastructure using aws services. ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of digital solutions.
4. workflow optimization: utilize monday.com to create and optimize workflows that improve efficiency and collaboration among departments. customize and automate tasks to align with departmental needs.
5. innovation and change: drive initiatives that support the company’s change transformation and innovation objectives. identify and propose new technologies and processes that can benefit the organization.
6. collaboration: work closely with it, finance, operations, and other departments to understand their needs and develop automation solutions that address their specific challenges.
7. monitoring and support: monitor the performance of implemented solutions, provide ongoing support, and make adjustments as necessary to ensure optimal functionality and effectiveness.

inviting applications for the role of lead consultant, senior test automation engineer!

in this role, you will be a key member of our test automation and global development team. you will design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans and cases while collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure robust test coverage. your expertise in functional testing and automation frameworks will help us deliver high-quality enterprise platforms.

responsibilities

·       design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases.

·       collaborate with development, product management, and other cross-functional teams to understand requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.

·       perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.

·       develop, execute, and maintain automated test scripts.

·       potentially work on the continuous integration framework for the automation suite.

·       build automation frameworks and scripts for end-to-end testing, including api, ui, and other types of testing.

·       identify, document, and track software defects and work with the development team to resolve issues.


qualifications we seek in you!

minimum qualifications / skills

·       experience in software testing and test automation.

·       strong java skills.

·       proficiency in selenium or playwright.

·       experience with sql and rest apis.

·       strong core testing skills with the ability to influence test approaches for repeatable testing and sustainable automation.

·       experience working on enterprise erp platforms.

·       familiarity with etl testing and ci/cd processes.

 


preferred qualifications/ skills

·       strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.

·       ability to operate independently while following existing framework guidelines.

·       resourcefulness in problem-solving and clear articulation of outputs for non-technical stakeholders.

·       capability to navigate vague specifications and coordinate with stakeholders to clarify expectations.

·       committed to ethical ai – work in an environment where governance, transparency, and security are at the core of everything we build

·       thrive in a values-driven culture – our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness - built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion - allow your ideas to fuel progress

primary responsibilities:

implement overall test automation strategy, including tool selection, framework architecture, and best practices.

develop automation test plans and schedules based on project timelines and goals.

architect, design, and maintain test automation frameworks for different types of testing (functional, regression, performance, etc.). 

ensure automation scripts are reusable, modular, and aligned with project needs.

lead and mentor a team of test automation engineers, providing technical guidance, training, and performance feedback.

promote knowledge sharing and best practices within the team.

work closely with cross-functional teams (development, qa, devops, product management) to understand testing needs and ensure proper integration of test automation.

act as a point of contact for test automation-related discussions with stakeholders, providing regular status updates on test progress and results.

ensure automated test execution is part of the continuous integration process and provide feedback on build quality.

oversee the execution of automated test suites and ensure proper logging, monitoring, and reporting of results.

o track and analyze test execution metrics, identify test failures, and coordinate with development teams for quick resolution.

o establish and enforce standards, processes, and best practices for test automation across teams and projects.

conduct regular code reviews of automation scripts to ensure quality, maintainability, and scalability.

stay updated with the latest automation tools, technologies, and trends.

evaluate and recommend new tools or practices that can enhance the overall testing process and team efficiency.

collaborate with the defect management team to track, prioritize, and resolve software bugs.

provide detailed reports on defects, coverage, and the overall health of the software based on automated test results.

mandatory skills 

ui test automation 

primary: playwright utilizes javascript

others: selenium-/ java based based frameworks 

advanced automation development experience expert automation experience esp. automation test case design for a variety of technology/applications under test (web, file comparison) 

intermediate software testing experience general qa / testing design, planning, optimization experience 

agile - experience working in agile/scrum environments, participating in sprint planning, backlog grooming, and daily standups.

framework - expert hands-on experience with developing or utilizing existing frameworks

ui test automation - expert in playwrite: working knowledge of selenium or any other automation toolset

api test automation - expert-level using playwright. rest assured or equivalent api tool, like soap ui pro

test data

expertise in managing test environments, test data, and configurations to ensure reliable and repeatable automation results.

understanding of environment provisioning, test isolation, and the use of virtualization or containerization technologies. 

cloud-based

working knowledge of cloud environments (aws, azure, gcp)

experience with cloud-based testing tools and platforms (e.g., sauce labs, browserstack).

preferred qualifications

at least 3-5 years similar working experience in automation testing

about datacomwith over 6,200 people and centres of technical excellence across australasia, datacom is committed to developing its capabilities in asia. founded in 1965 in new zealand, with over two decades of operations in malaysia and the philippines, datacom has experienced exponential growth.

we maintain high profitability while delivering innovative, cost-effective digital and technology solutions through dynamic teams in various locations. our people are skilled, passionate, and dedicated to providing exceptional it services, making datacom a rewarding and fast-paced workplace. our purpose

we connect people and technology to solve challenges, create opportunities, and discover new possibilities for our communities.our team

proficiency in at least one programming language (java, ruby, python, etc.) - must. experience with api testing tools such as soapui and postman is a plus. understanding of context-based and risk-based testing of complex business applications.

knowledge of jenkins and git is beneficial. experience with test management tools like jira and confluence. previous experience with insurance, documents, claims, policy management, and billing systems is advantageous.

experience working on complex enterprise-wide technology platforms. ability to coach and mentor junior to mid-level testers. strong written and verbal communication skills.

why join us at datacom? as one of australia and new zealand’s largest it professional service providers, we maintain a dynamic, agile environment with a small business feel.

we strive to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace, committed to creating a fun, friendly environment where everyone feels supported.

brief summary of the role:
the engineering team leader is the overall accountable in ensuring all installation, maintenance, modification, overhaul and service, and repair of all line equipment are provided with quality service. ensuring proper execution of all planned and corrective maintenance work and productive utilization of technicians, and contractors reporting directly.

key responsibilities:

1. general administration and execution of management policies
• contributes to the creation and implementation of best practice, vision, strategy, policies, processes, and procedures to aid and improve operational performance of manufacturing.
• ensures brand and consumer trust by implementing all quality, food safety, environment, and occupational health and safety standards, in accordance with kore as well as regulatory requirements set by the dole, denr, dti, fda local government units and all other regulatory agencies relevant to its operations.
• ensures achievement of all site performance metrics in terms of quality, safety, productivity, service level and cost and conduct of necessary routine reviews, action planning, and execution to support the over-all business objective of the company.
• interprets trends, provides analyses, and reviews data relevant to plant manufacturing operations. provides processed manufacturing data to other stakeholders in the organization to push for efficiencies and improvements.
• ensure metrics, reports, and process documentation is available.
• partners with stakeholders in programs and initiatives that will enhance customer relationship and attain smooth issues resolution.
• partners and directs stakeholders from other functions in program and initiatives, and day-to-day activities within the general scope of the role.

2. operations
• provide specialist technical support for line equipment maintenance
• under/ over or inappropriate maintenance activities identified.
• maintenance schedules reviewed periodically
• equipment availability, speed and throughput analyzed
• assist to compile and manage the maintenance resource budget
• provide proposals for replacement of equipment and or upgrades for the yearly capex budgets
• manage equipment upgrades and technological changes

3. maintenance execution
• project manage all line equipment & other assigned areas overhauls
• ensuring proper execution of all planned and corrective maintenance work to all line equipment and other areas assigned
• provide input to and manage expenditure for the unit equipment repairs and maintenance budget
• recommendations made to improve maintenance mix
• standard engineering practices, sop’s developed, documented & implemented
• root cause analyses carried out on breakdowns
• oem support/ specialist called in immediately if it is identified that repair cannot be effected without further support.
• report on breakdowns & repairs carried out completed as per work instruction.
• ensure work orders checked for completion, signed off & captured on cmms

4. management system implementation
• leads line hirac and line haccp according to policy
• participates in and conducts plant audits
• ensures that documentation and records keeping are effectively done
• ensures compliance of the whole team with all management system policies

5. people management
• conducts interviews and selects, the most suitable candidate for vacant positions in his team.
• provides regular coaching and mentoring to assigned associates to ensure that expectations from the role are constantly met.
• conducts regular performance reviews to manage team performance and to set a clear career plan of his/her direct reports.
• identifies training gaps of each member of the team and facilitates the execution of the training plans to ensure that a career development plan for each associate is provided.
• develop and implement effective feedback and recognition system for his direct reports.
• reviews and approves the attendance of the team, including leaves, shifting and overtime, to ensure continuous operations and compliance with cost directions, budget and company policies and procedures.
• implements company rules and regulations among his direct reports and performs consequence management or impose disciplinary measures in cases of violations.
• spearheads people development forum/ succession planning for his team with the rest of the leadership team and ensures progress on the identified development areas for each of his subordinates.
• works with the rest of the management team in laying-down and executing programs in his area of assignment.
• review contracts of service provider and provides people team opportunities areas.
• responsible in promoting industrial peace and cultivating engaged labor unions; ensures they are aligned with company directions.
• actively participates in the collective bargaining agreement negotiations. leads closure of grievance cases and lmc issues and concerns.

6. continuous improvement
• performs regular loss analysis for the assigned line as input for the strategic plans for the line
• develops and ensures implementation of corrective actions plans (cap) for missed kpis and non-compliance
• conducts regular line performance reviews to identify action steps to ensure consistently good kpi results
• manages special projects that will be assigned to the team

• with good leadership and communication skills

• with experienced in handling improvement projects

job summary:

responsible to estimate assembly and test labor hours for the semicon equipments and sub-assemblies during the quote process. responsible for planning and conducting independent work requiring judgment in the evaluation, product understanding, application and adaptation of manufacturing techniques, procedures and criteria. devise new approaches to assembly and test, specifications, calculations, charts and graphs, and effectively estimate the labor hours for compliance to applicable build and quality standards. 

essential duties and responsibilities:

requires a broad knowledge of manufacturing practices, assembly prints, bill of materials to be able to create manufacturing flow, lean flow, bay build approaches such as s.o.e.’s (sequence of events) and assembly process workflow.

establish process for manufacturing and taking into consideration of how work instruction for assembly and test will be prepared with the labor hours estimation.

able to understand the flat bom vs multi-level bom and break it into modular assemblies and stack-up assemblies.

collaborate with de (design engineer) to understand the make/buy decision and fine tune based on the stand-alone assemblies leading to buy or make decisions.

work with site me manager and engineers to understand the capabilities and also understanding other uct site capabilities for effective labor hours estimation.

initiate and support design for excellence and manufacturing process improvement / standardization.

engage with respective site ie to optimize layout and to review the labor hours in case if any doubt arises especially if it is a new type of build never done before.

liaise and coordinate with design engineering, accounts operations, account executives, supply chain, quote team wheneve necessary and have doubts.

liaise and coordinate with test engineering department on testing development or testing issue to estimate test hours.

liaise with customer for all bom / drawing / design issue by generating problem report / supplier problem sheet / supplier request deviation that affects the labor hours estimation.

minimum cad knowledge to analyst 3d drawing from customer.

understanding of routing and labor hours in sap and mes systems.

other duties

knowledge, skills and abilities:

lean manufacturing principles, understanding of mechanical assemblies, wire routing, test.

familiarity with semiconductor capital equipment.

knowledge of electronic work instruction software is a plus (i.e. sequence).

erp/mes system software

excellent computer skills in microsoft suite, emphasis in excel.

prior experience in manufacturing of assemblies and test is a must

good interpersonal skills; ability to work alone or in team environment.

educational/certification requirement:

bachelor’s degree in mechanical/electrical/electronics /mechatronics/industrial systems engineering with 2 years of manufacturing experience in related field.

diploma in mechanical / electrical / electronics / mechatronics / industrial systems engineering with minimum 5 years working experience in related field can apply.

experience requirement:

minimum 2 years relevant experience (5 years for diploma holder)

exposure to semiconductor industry preferred.

experience on setting up lean line will be a plus

know and able to explore full bom structure (more than 1,000 line) is needed.

self-motivated and resourceful

possesses drive with “can-do” attitude

capable of developing positive work relationship, a favourable work environment within the team and other functional group

must able to perform and demonstrate good workmanship understanding according to industrial standard.

good interpersonal, communication and presentation skill.

able to perform any other task assigned by manager / supervisor.

comply to work ethics and integrity.

candidate with six sigma knowledge is a plus

must be a graduate of computer engineering / computer science / information tech or any related 4 yrs course.

knowledgeable in plc, hmi (particularly in keyence ) and debugging.

team leadership:manage and mentor a team of engineers and technicians, fostering a culture of diversity, excellence and continuous improvement.
strategic planning:develop and execute long-term strategies for the electronics division, aligning with company goals and market trends.

continuous improvement:drive a culture of continuous improvement in product safety, reliability, quality, cost reduction, and development time reduction, aiming to build knowledge and improve organically.
collaboration:establish excellent communication and a collaborative mindset with other rdd leaders across engineering and category teams to solve problems and introduce improvements collectively.

minimum of 8 years of experience in electronics product development and manufacturing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
proven track record of successful product launches and site management.
strong knowledge of industry standards and regulatory requirements.

we are seeking a proactive and organized technical coordinator to join our dynamic team. this role serves as the central point of communication between clients, service engineers, and internal operations. the technical coordinator is responsible for in office client communication, maintaining inventory of machine parts, and ensuring smooth coordination of technical support activities. if you have strong communication skills, a technical mindset, and a passion for operational efficiency, we'd love to hear from you.

educational background:

graduate of any of the following:

bachelor’s degree in information technology (bsit),

computer science (bscs),

mechatronics engineering (bsmee),

business administration major in operations management (bsba), or

office administration (bsoa).

work experience:

coordinate the schedule and dispatch of service engineers.

maintain physical inventory of spare parts, ensure availability, and reorder when stock is low.

prepare basic reports on service activities and inventory levels.
